body.name: Topsand Latest Android 13 Tablet, 8 Inch Tablet Quad-Core 2.0 GHz Processor with 64GB Storage, 1TB Expandable, Dual Auto Focus Camera with Face ID Unlock, GPS, Parental Control, 2.4G & 5G WiFi Tableta
deliveryMessages: Or fastest delivery Tuesday, February 13. Order within 6 hrs 41 mins
Or fastest pickup Tomorrow, February 12. Order within 5 hrs 41 mins
features: ✅BLAZING FAST PERFORMANCE - Topsand's new Android 13 mini tablet packs a lightning-quick 2.0GHz quad-core processor, leveraging ARM's big.LITTLE and 12nm tech for up to 20% faster speed over mainstream octa-cores. You'll blaze through work and play with seamless, snappy performance.

✅LATEST ANDROID 13 - This small android tablet for adults features the newest Android 13 OS with enhanced privacy, customizations and tablet-optimized features. Certified by Google with fast WiFi, 3GB RAM and 64GB storage expandable to 1TB, you'll never lack space. Unlock new possibilities with this newest tablet.

✅IMMERSIVE VIEWING EXPERIENCE - With its 8-inch 1280x800 display and dual speakers, this Android tablet 8 inch delivers an immersive viewing experience whether on-the-go or wirelessly projected. The crisp, clear screen and surround sound audio provide quality visuals and sound for fully enjoying entertainment and media.

✅CAPTURE LIFE'S MOMENTS - Instantly capture life's moments with secure Face ID access. Dual high-resolution 2MP and 8MP auto-focus cameras equip you to take incredibly crisp photos and remarkably clear video chats. A robust 5100mAh battery powers up to 8 hours of endless entertainment.

✅THE PERFECT GIFT - With durable metal body and portable design, this Topsand N8 small Android tablet computer makes an ideal gift for adults, seniors and kids alike. We stand firmly behind quality, providing a 12-month comprehensive warranty and 24/7 U.S.-based customer support. (NOTE: We aim to reply within 24 hours. If you don't hear back, please check your spam folder - our response may be there.)

productInformation.name: Warranty Description
productInformation.value: Amazon.com Return Policy:You may return any new computer purchased from Amazon.com that is "dead on arrival," arrives in damaged condition, or is still in unopened boxes, for a full refund within 30 days of purchase. Amazon.com reserves the right to test "dead on arrival" returns and impose a customer fee equal to 15 percent of the product sales price if the customer misrepresents the condition of the product. Any returned computer that is damaged through customer misuse, is missing parts, or is in unsellable condition due to customer tampering will result in the customer being charged a higher restocking fee based on the condition of the product. Amazon.com will not accept returns of any desktop or notebook computer more than 30 days after you receive the shipment. New, used, and refurbished products purchased from Marketplace vendors are subject to the returns policy of the individual vendor.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A Stellar Budget Tablet!
reviews.reviewText: I must say that this android tablet has exceeded all my expectations.Despite its affordable price, this 8 inch tablet handles multitasking and app-switching remarkably well. I can smoothly navigate through apps, stream content, and browse the internetwithout any lag so far.The tablet's battery life is exceptional. With moderate usage, I have found that it easily lasts for an entire day, making it extremely convenient for traveling or working on the go.Don't miss out on this budget-friendly gem!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Excellent battery life, display screen and processor performance. The sound is good via the onboard speakers. I have not yet used the camera. The GPS works well for navigation.11/21/2023 edited to add: the tablet will not reliably power off or restart via the power button. I now leave it on constantly since it is such a hassle to get it to turn off and turn back on again. I subtracted one star from the rating.11/29/2023 edited to add: the seller contacted me and graciously refunded the cost of the tablet and I am adding the subtracted star to my rating. I reset the tablet to the original settings and the power button problem continued. I wonder if it is an intermittent hardware fault but I am no longer using it. Excellent customer service by the seller.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Just the right size
reviews.reviewText: This little tablet was perfect for a device for my grandkids to play on. Wireless connection was simple. It's smaller and lighter size made it easier for them to handle. Their games played without delay. They had no problems hearing their games. The battery life was longer than i thought it would be. There are plenty of parental controls to help keep them safe. Very pleasantly surprised.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Good tablet. Fair price!
reviews.reviewText: The tablet is perfect size because it's not as big as a regular tablet, but bigger than a phone and still easy to hold! Great for kids and smaller hands!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 2, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars No customer service
reviews.reviewText: Could not connect although it recognized my internet service. Have had two other tablets with no such issues. Contacted the customer service number, but the call was never returned. Returned for refund.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Only lasted two weeks
reviews.reviewText: Sucks only lasted two weeks, Sent it back and got a Samsung. Last time I'll cheap out on electronics.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love this beast. Great battery life.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 20, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars It's a fair price for "pure" Android
reviews.reviewText: The last time I tried a generic tablet was at the onset of the tablet revolution around 2012 or so - and it was not good. A decade later, the technology has evolved to where even a generic can be useful for basic tasks. My mother has a Fire HD 8 Plus 2020, which she uses to browse the Web. The drawback of an Amazon tablet is that the OS is proprietary, aimed to promote their own goods and services, which I think would be tolerable except for the fact that "proprietary" means any Android app has to be adapted for use in the Amazon app store, and there are simply not enough apps adapted. Yes, all the "major" ones are, but if you want to use something particular like the HEB grocery store app, the Amazon tablet doesn't support it. HEB is not some obscure niche interest, it's the biggest grocery retailer in Texas. Texas is big, but not big enough for Amazon apparently. So, I've been contemplating getting my mother a "pure" Android tablet.I let her try out this one, but she says "it's too heavy", which she also said about the Samsung she tried, which is curious because this tablet, the Samsung, and the Fire HD8 Plus 2020 are all equivalent in weight. The listing for this Topsand says "662 grams" but that's got to be the weight of the package, the tablet itself weighs in at 359 grams, the HD8 Plus 2020 at 355 grams, and the Samsung Tab 8.4 2020 the lightest at 309 grams. And my mother's Fire is even heavier by about 150 grams because of the case. But I guess she likes the way the weight is distributed, even though all three tablets appear to have the same 8x5 dimensions.Weight issue aside, the fact of the matter is that this Topsand is equivalent, in specs and in price, to the Fire HD8 Plus 2020, but you get "pure Android" (and OS 13). You could try getting the 2022 HD8 Plus, which has a 30% faster processor, and wireless charging. But it's more expensive. Then again, you could try for a refurb at around $90. Or, you could get a Samsung Tab 8.4, which is 2020, but has both a better resolution (1200x1920) and a better processor (octa-core) and while a new one is $130, you could easily find a used one for about $75. However, the Tab 8.4 is only upgradeable to Android 11. Is there a reason you might need Android 13? And some people are more comfortable with lower resolutions.The other problem with a generic is that if you really want a case for it, you only have generic options. My mother has the case specific to her tablet, and I always use Otterbox for mine.
8歳の孫にプレゼントしました。喜んでいますが、アンドロイドなので、アイホンのゲームは出来ません。

reviews.reviewerName: 安心の純正安心の純正
reviews.reviewTitle: バッテリーの持ちが良い
reviews.reviewText: Android 13タブレットを使ってみて、思った以上に使いやすくて驚きました！画面のクオリティも素晴らしく、持ち運びもラクチンです。バッテリーの持ちも良くて外出時にも便利だと感じました。価格が手ごろで、コスパはバッチリです！
仕事用に購入しました。主に、検索結果を表示させたり、資料の閲覧、動画を流したりなどに使用しています。動作に不便さを感じることも無く、何よりバッテリーの持ちが良く助かっています。外に居るとなかなか充電する時間や場所が限られてくるためです。少し負荷のかかる作業をする時は、動作が重いと感じる時もありますが、スペックを考えれば妥当なのかと思います。
動作などは問題無しですが、手のひらから滑りやすいので、裏側に滑り止めを貼りました。
設定も簡単思ってたよりサクサク動作する。
